p: As for changes in sex life, respondents reported decreases in their satisfaction with their sex life (13.4%), their sexual activity (13.5%), their sex-seeking activity (6.7%), and their use of protection for sex (1.4%) during the COVID-19 pandemic. By contrast, respondents reported increases in their satisfaction with their sex life (1.9%), their sexual activity (2.9%), their sex-seeking activity (1.9%), and their use of protection for sex (1.6%) during the COVID-19 pandemic.
